name: PXEBoot
body: # pxeboot pxeboot # Klouds.io / Klouds.org [![wercker status](https://app.wercker.com/status/fcf719ade20c4ab01184d966f4650ee2/s/master "wercker status")](https://app.wercker.com/project/bykey/fcf719ade20c4ab01184d966f4650ee2) [![Join the chat at https://gitter.im/Superordinate/klouds](https://badges.gitter.im/Join%20Chat.svg)](https://gitter.im/Superordinate/klouds?utm_source=badge&utm_medium=badge&utm_campaign=pr-badge&utm_content=badge) [![Code Climate](https://codeclimate.com/github/Superordinate/klouds/badges/gpa.svg)](https://codeclimate.com/github/Superordinate/klouds) PXE (Pre eXecution Environment), affectionately pronounced Pixie (as in fairy dust), is a method of having an end computer (client) boot using only its network card. If you regularly install tens or hundreds of PCâ€™s, you can start the installer on all those machines at once without needing to have individual boot/install media for each machine.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
